title: LME aluminium cash offer drops to $2,765.5/t while opening stock climbs to 548,000t
summary: LME aluminium prices eased on November 21 with cash and three-month contracts declining modestly. Exchange inventories increased, with opening stock rising to 548,000 tonnes. Forward values also weakened amid a slight drop in cash and three-month bids and offers.

title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
summary: Aluminum prices dropped as much as 1.6% to $2,526 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, the lowest since November 14, amid a broad commodity pullback. The decline followed data showing record-high Chinese output in November, driven by booming exports and the end of export tax discounts.

title: Manual Processing Profit Narrowed in October, Short-Term Primary Aluminum Imports Expected to Decrease [SMM Analysis]
summary: Profit margins for manual processing of aluminum narrowed in October, with expectations of decreased primary aluminum imports in the short term. Production cuts at an Icelandic smelter and tightening overseas supply have pushed LME aluminum prices higher, while high premiums in Europe and the US may divert supply away from China.

title: Aluminum Market Trends
summary: The 2025 US aluminum market faces uncertainty with analysts anticipating a recovery in bauxite and alumina supply after a volatile 2024. Domestic scrap shortages persist, and supply-demand dynamics continue to influence market trends.

title: Aluminum fell to 2,805.70 USD/T on November 21, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices fell 0.25% to $2,805.70 per tonne on November 21, 2025. Despite a slight monthly decline of 0.15%, prices remain 6.48% higher than a year ago, reflecting ongoing market fluctuations.

title: Manual Processing Profit Narrowed in October, Short-Term Primary Aluminum Imports Expected to Decrease [SMM Analysis]
summary: China's primary aluminum imports in October 2025 rose slightly by 0.6% month-on-month and 42.1% year-on-year, while exports decreased 15.2% MoM but increased 54.2% YoY. Production cuts at an Icelandic smelter and expectations of overseas supply tightening pushed LME aluminum prices higher, though SHFE prices lagged, narrowing profit margins for manual processing and likely reducing imports under handbook processing.

title: Limited Commissioning of New Projects Leads to Slow Growth in Aluminum Production in 2025
summary: China's operating aluminum capacity in 2025 approached the ceiling of compliant capacity with limited new project commissioning, resulting in slow capacity growth. Production cuts due to losses and technological transformation projects resuming contributed to an expected 1.7% year-on-year production growth. Regional capacity increases include resumed production in Sichuan and Guangxi provinces, with overall operating capacity up by 538,000 mt compared to 2024.

title: Aluminum fell to 2,805.70 USD/T on November 21, 2025, down 0.25% from the previous day
summary: China reaffirmed its focus on curbing overcapacity in metal production to ease deflationary pressures, with the aluminum output ceiling of 45 million tons expected to be exceeded next year. Supply pressures were compounded by disruptions such as the suspension of a potline at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter and Alcoa's planned closure of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia due to deteriorating bauxite ore grades.

title: LME aluminium cash offer drops to $2,765.5/t while opening stock climbs to 548,000t
summary: LME aluminum prices eased on November 21, 2025, with the cash bid and offer both dropping by approximately 0.47%. Meanwhile, exchange inventories increased, with opening stock climbing to 548,000 tonnes, indicating a slight softening in market prices amid rising stock levels.

title: ITRI Wins Three R&D 100 Awards for Breakthroughs in Regenerative Medicine and Sustainable Technologies
summary: ITRI has been recognized with three R&D 100 Awards for innovations in regenerative medicine and sustainable technologies, highlighting advancements that could impact aluminum sustainability and industrial processes.

title: Nickel Prices Enter Downward Channel as Weakening Costs Keep Stainless Steel Under Pressure
summary: Nickel prices are trending downward due to weakening costs, which is putting pressure on stainless steel prices. The article highlights ongoing market dynamics affecting stainless steel and related commodities.

title: Stock prices of US' steel industry skyrocket on Nov 24
summary: US steel industry stock prices surged on November 24, driven by acute supply shortages. The article notes strong market reactions to limited steel availability.

title: Tata Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of November 24, 2025
summary: Tata Steel Ltd shares declined by 0.15% on November 24, trading at ₹167.75 per share. Investors are closely watching the stock amid ongoing market volatility.

title: US steel shipments lifted by tariffs in Q3
summary: US steel producers reported record shipments in Q3 as tariffs reduced imports. The article discusses how trade policies are influencing domestic steel market dynamics.

title: ENR November 24, 2025: CONSTRUCTION ECONOMICS
summary: Monthly prices for reinforcing bars fell 0.1%, while yearly prices are down 15.1%. The article covers recent trends in construction steel prices and the producer price index for sheet metal.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Chinese steel rebar futures rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since November, as Beijing's anti-involution policy led to lower supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% year-on-year in October, the lowest for the month since 2021, while exports dropped 12.5% due to protectionist policies abroad.

title: Global steel production ticked higher in October
summary: World crude steel output rose 1% from September to October, reaching 143.3 million metric tons, after four consecutive monthly declines. China's output fell 12% year-on-year, while the rest of the world saw a 1% increase, with daily production at a 22-month low.

title: Global Crude Steel Production Declines by 5.9% in October 2025
summary: Global crude steel production declined 5.9% in October 2025 compared to the same month last year, with Asia and Oceania down 8.2% and Africa up 0.8%. The drop was mainly driven by continued weakness in China.

title: Germany increased steel production by 5.1% m/m in October
summary: Germany's steel production rose 5.1% month-on-month in October 2025, reflecting a regional uptick amid global production declines. The increase highlights ongoing shifts in European steelmaking capacity and output.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry is undergoing a significant transformation driven by AI, hydrogen-based methods, automation, and sustainability. Green steel production is gaining momentum as demand for low-carbon materials rises, with hydrogen playing a key role in decarbonizing steelmaking processes. Supply chain challenges are also pushing the industry toward tech-driven solutions.

title: Top US Steelmakers Driving Innovation & Talent Demand in 2025
summary: Leading U.S. steelmakers are modernizing operations with green steel, automation, and AI-driven process control to meet growing infrastructure and renewable energy demands. Companies like Nucor and Steel Dynamics are investing in low-carbon technologies, renewable energy, and biocarbon projects, emphasizing sustainability and advanced manufacturing.

title: Steel Meets Innovation: Emerging Technologies Reshaping the Sector
summary: Advances in AI and green steel technologies are driving innovation in the steel industry. Producers are adopting new technologies to enhance sustainability and efficiency across production stages, reflecting growing environmental concerns and market demand for greener steel products.

title: The Future of Steel Production: Innovations and Sustainability in the Global Steel Industry
summary: The steel industry is rapidly evolving with new technologies and sustainability initiatives aimed at reducing environmental impact. Innovations focus on carbon emission reductions and more efficient production methods to meet global demand while addressing climate concerns.

title: Commodity Update – November 2025
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange reached a new high driven by the US-China trade deal and intensifying supply disruptions at key mines. Despite a current surplus, production is expected to drop by 150,000 metric tons in 2026, signaling potential shortages. Copper prices have surged over 25% this year, supported by a weak US dollar and falling interest rates.

title: Japanese Customs Updates Copper Wire Nodules Standard LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Last Friday
summary: LME copper futures fluctuated upward last Friday, settling at $10,778/mt, up 0.86%. Market sentiment is supported by expectations of a US Federal Reserve interest rate cut and progress in US-led Russia-Ukraine negotiations, easing risk-off sentiment. Supply tightness eased somewhat due to warrant releases, while demand sentiment is recovering amid price corrections.

title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply
summary: Copper prices steadied at $10,777 a ton on the London Metal Exchange after retreating from a record high above $11,200 in late October. The market faces tensions due to China's expanding copper industry and falling annual fees, with potential changes to benchmark pricing systems. Upcoming events in China, including the Asia Copper Week and World Copper Conference, are expected to influence market dynamics.

title: Copper rises on US rate-cut bets; speculative interest fades
summary: Copper prices edged higher to $10,801 a ton supported by growing expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut in December. Despite the gains, speculative interest in copper has diminished due to the lack of strong market drivers. The Shanghai Futures Exchange also saw a price increase, reflecting positive sentiment from the London market.

title: Copper Processing Industry Faces Pricing Stress Test
summary: The global copper processing industry is expected to face a significant stress test in pricing mechanisms this week, reflecting ongoing market volatility and supply-demand imbalances. This could impact pricing stability and industry profitability in the near term.

title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply Talks
summary: The global copper-processing industry is facing a critical stress test as negotiations intensify amid China's dominance in securing copper concentrate supply and driving down processing fees. Chinese smelters continue to expand, crowding out international competitors and prompting concerns about the viability of the benchmark pricing system.

title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply Talks
summary: Geopolitical tensions and China's growing control over copper concentrate supply are putting pressure on the global benchmark pricing mechanism. The expansion of Chinese smelting capacity has led to plummeting processing fees and increased struggles for smelters outside China.

title: Copper Processing Industry Faces Pricing Stress Test
summary: The global copper processing industry is experiencing a major stress test due to China's dominance, constrained metal supplies, and the rapid expansion of processing capacity outpacing mined production. This is raising questions about the sustainability of the current benchmarking structure.

title: Australian Mining Giant BHP Drops Anglo American Takeover Bid
summary: BHP, a major Australian mining company, has withdrawn its takeover bid for Anglo American, which could impact future copper production and capacity expansion plans in the sector.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production, emphasizing its commitment to sustainable mining and operational excellence. The company aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% by 2030 and reach net zero by 2050 through strategies like electrifying operations and expanding renewable energy use. BHP expects global copper demand to rise by about 70% by 2050, reaching over 50 million tonnes per year.

title: Copper Mining Methods 2025: Innovations & Sustainability
summary: The article explores advanced copper mining methods focusing on innovation, sustainability, digital transformation, and responsible resource extraction. It highlights that over 60% of new copper mines in 2025 will use autonomous equipment to increase operational efficiency and reduce environmental impact. Farmonaut provides satellite-based data and real-time insights to empower mining operations for a more sustainable future.

title: Energy Efficiency in Copper Processing Plants 2025: Technology, Sustainability & Innovation
summary: Energy-efficient copper processing plants in 2025 cut emissions by up to 30% using advanced technologies such as automation, digitization, smelting improvements, thermal recovery systems, and renewable energy integration. The sector is transforming to reduce waste, minimize emissions, and optimize costs, with blockchain-based traceability ensuring supply chain transparency and authenticity.

title: Copper supply crunch threatens energy and digital transitions
summary: UNCTAD warns that a looming copper shortfall could stall global green and digital transitions due to rising demand and supply challenges like declining ore grades and geopolitical tensions. The report calls for investment in local value addition, scaled-up recycling, and removal of trade barriers to support a circular economy and reduce import dependence, especially for developing countries.

title: Innovations in Copper Mining and Production May Benefit the Environment
summary: The Zero Emission Copper Mine of the Future project in Australia aims to make copper mining emission-free over the next 30 years using emerging technologies. This initiative highlights the fundamental changes needed in energy sourcing, consumption, and abatement to achieve zero emissions, supporting copper's role in green innovation and reducing environmental impact.

title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply Talks
summary: China's dominant position in copper supply is influencing critical supply talks, with the country deploying digital tools to drive efficiency in copper production. This dynamic is shaping the global copper market amid rising demand and supply challenges.

title: Copper's role in the energy transition grows as demand surges
summary: Copper companies are increasing production while embracing sustainability and leveraging digital innovations to meet surging demand driven by the energy transition. Digital technologies like AWP, BIM, GIS, and digital twins are optimizing mining capital projects for efficiency, safety, and timely delivery.

title: Nickel Prices Enter Downward Channel as Weakening Costs Keep Stainless Steel Under Pressure
summary: Nickel prices have entered a downward channel due to weakening costs and increased production capacity in China and Indonesia. The oversupply and weak demand are keeping stainless steel prices under pressure, with little room for a near-term rebound in nickel prices.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices have dropped to 14,532.00 USD/ton, the lowest since April 2025, losing 4.57% over the past four weeks and 8.05% over the past year. The market remains bearish due to persistent oversupply and weak demand.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November period I
summary: Indonesia's Nickel Miners Association (APNI) set the benchmark price for nickel ore at $15,075.33/wmt for the first half of November 2025, a slight decrease from October. Prices for various grades of nickel ore also declined marginally.

title: On November 24, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price was reported at 115,400–120,100 yuan/mt on November 24, with an average price of 117,750 yuan/mt, up 1,050 yuan/mt from the previous day. The market saw a slight rebound amid ongoing oversupply concerns.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Rebound Slightly on November 24 as US-Ukraine Talks Make Significant Progress
summary: Nickel prices rebounded slightly on November 24, with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 117,750 yuan/mt, up 1,050 yuan/mt from the previous day. The rebound was attributed to progress in US-Ukraine talks, but oversupply remains a concern.

title: MMG's deal to buy Anglo American's Brazil nickel assets faces EU regulatory delay
summary: MMG's acquisition of Anglo American's Brazilian nickel assets is facing delays due to regulatory scrutiny from the European Commission, which is concerned the deal could divert ferronickel supplies away from Europe and negatively impact the European stainless steel industry.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November (Period I)
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association (APNI) has announced the benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, providing updated guidance for the domestic market amid ongoing supply and pricing volatility.

title: SMM Nickel Ore Port Inventory
summary: On November 24, 2025, the national port nickel ore inventory in China increased by 97,000 wet tons, reaching a total of 10.106 million wet tons, reflecting continued high supply levels and inventory buildup.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to $14,549.75 per tonne on November 24, 2025, down 0.48% from the previous day, continuing a downward trend as global supply outpaces demand and inventories remain elevated.

title: Nickel industry - Part 4 Sustainability considerations for nickel production
summary: This article explores sustainability challenges and innovations in nickel production, focusing on environmental impact reduction and responsible mining practices. It highlights ongoing efforts to improve the sustainability of nickel throughout its lifecycle, from extraction to end-use.

title: CVA and Cogne Acciai Speciali sign Energy Release contract to boost renewable energy use
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali (CAS) and CVA Group signed an Energy Release contract, the first of its kind in the Aosta Valley and among the first nationally. This agreement supports CAS in advancing renewable energy use by requesting advance electricity from new photovoltaic plants in Sicily, enhancing energy performance and reducing environmental impact in line with regional and European green goals.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of its green hydrogen production project at its Aosta plant, aiming to reduce carbon emissions by using electrolysis to produce green hydrogen. The project includes a 1.008 MW electrolyzer capable of producing 165 tons of hydrogen annually, supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali uses 100% renewable electricity at all its European plants
source: Vietnam Steel by Hoa Sen Group
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali announced that since January 2024, all its European plants operate using 100% renewable electricity, achieving zero impact in terms of scope 2 emissions. The company operates seven plants globally, with five in Europe, and is expanding through acquisitions such as the US-based Mannesmann Stainless Tubes.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from certified renewable sources. The report emphasizes the company's commitment to sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.

title: Greenland Resources Signs MOU With Italian Cogne for Long-Term Molybdenum Supply
summary: Greenland Resources signed a memorandum of understanding with Cogne Acciai Speciali for long-term molybdenum supply. Cogne is a global leader in special steel and stainless steel production, and this agreement supports strategic supply chain initiatives for both companies.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion in Italy focusing on the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe’s energy transition and Italy’s potential to strengthen its boilermaking industry. The event highlighted advances in nuclear technology and Tenaris’s recent accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities according to ASME III standards.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris’s seamless steel pipe mill in Dalmine, Italy, obtained ASME III certification for supplying materials for nuclear facilities, enabling it to participate in the global nuclear energy market. This certification supports the nuclear sector's role in the low-carbon energy transition and ensures compliance with stringent international safety standards.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported solid third-quarter 2025 results with stable sales of tubular products and services, including in North America and Mexico. The company noted impacts from tariff increases on steel imports and expects costs and margins to be affected in the fourth quarter. Welded pipe volumes increased while seamless volumes slightly declined.
